title: Linux rwho Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the rwho command in Linux, which allows you to monitor users logged into remote systems. Learn how to utilize this tool for user monitoring and system management.

meta.title: Linux rwho Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the rwho command in Linux, which allows you to monitor users logged into remote systems. Learn how to utilize this tool for user monitoring and system management.
meta.keywords: Linux, rwho, user monitoring, system management, remote login, system monitoring

verify.name: Verify the rwho command output
verify.hint: The `rwho` command should display information about the currently logged-in users, including the user "labex". Please ensure that the `rwho` command is working correctly.

steps.title: Explore the Output of the rwho Command

verify.name: Verify the rwho command output fields
verify.hint: The `rwho` command should display the expected output fields, including "User", "tty", "host", "login@", "idle", and "where". Please ensure that the output contains all of these fields.

steps.title: Utilize the rwho Command for User Monitoring

verify.name: Verify the rwho command in a loop
verify.hint: The `rwho` command should be executed in a loop, displaying the output every 5 seconds. The output should contain the "User" field, indicating that the command is working as expected.
